org.tmotte.pdfrpt

Class SimplePDF

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tmotte.pdfrpt.SimplePDF
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class SimplePDF
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable

    A wrapper for the iText PDF library, for use by itself or with the org.tmotte.pdfrpt.report package (in either case with iText, of course). It attempts to simplify the most common tasks involved in rendering PDF output, including fonts, colors, text positioning, line art, and images.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimplePDF(java.io.OutputStream outStream)
      Shortcut to SimplePDF(outStream, new PageInfo()).
      SimplePDF(java.io.OutputStream outStream, PageInfo pageInfo)
      Starts a new PDF, to be written to outStream, and using the specified page size and margins.
      SimplePDF(java.io.OutputStream outStream, com.itextpdf.text.Rectangle pageSize)
      Shortcut to SimplePDF(outStream, new PageInfo(pageSize)).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the internal iText Document object and the OutputStream.
      SimplePDF draw(com.itextpdf.text.Image image)
      Draws image at the current X,Y coordinate position, according the size determined by image.getScaledHeight() and image.getScaledWidth()
      SimplePDF draw(java.lang.String text)
      Draws text to the right of the current X,Y coordinate position.
      SimplePDF drawAndMoveX(java.lang.String text)
      Draws text to the right of the current X,Y coordinate position and moves the X coordinate to the end of the text; equivalent to draw(text).moveX(getWidth(text)).
      SimplePDF drawCentered(java.lang.String text, float width)
      Draws text centered on the current X,Y coordinate position.
      SimplePDF drawLine(float xDistance, float yDistance)
      Draws a straight line from the current X,Y coordinates according to the distance specified by xDistance and yDistance, using the current line width and color.
      SimplePDF drawRect(float width, float height)
      Draws a rectangle outline from the current X,Y coordinates according to the distance specified by width and height, using the current line width and color.
      SimplePDF drawRectRounded(float width, float height, float offsetTL, float offsetTR, float offsetBR, float offsetBL)
      Generally the same as drawRect(), but with rounded corners.
      SimplePDF drawToLeft(java.lang.String text)
      Draws text to the left of the current X,Y coordinate position, i.e.
      SimplePDF fillRect(float width, float height)
      Fills in a rectangle from the current X,Y coordinates according to the distance specified by width and height, using the current line width.
      SimplePDF fillRectRounded(float width, float height, float offsetTL, float offsetTR, float offsetBR, float offsetBL)
      The same as drawRectRounded(), but fills the rectangle with the current color.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimplePDF

        public SimplePDF(java.io.OutputStream outStream,
                 PageInfo pageInfo)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Starts a new PDF, to be written to outStream, and using the specified page size and margins. Invoke SimplePDF.close() when the PDF is finished.
        Parameters:
        pageInfo - Margin and page/width height settings are copied from pageInfo. Changing pageInfo's settings afterwards will have no effect on existing instances of SimplePDF the used it in their constructor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        PageSize

      • SimplePDF

        public SimplePDF(java.io.OutputStream outStream,
                 com.itextpdf.text.Rectangle pageSize)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Shortcut to SimplePDF(outStream, new PageInfo(pageSize)).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • SimplePDF

        public SimplePDF(java.io.OutputStream outStream)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Shortcut to SimplePDF(outStream, new PageInfo()). The PDF will use portrait/letter page size.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • saveState

        public SimplePDF saveState()
        Saves all of the state concerning font, color, and line width of drawn lines; does not save margin settings or X-Y coordinate position. Use restoreState() to reset back to the prior state.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If saveState has already been called without a following call to restoreState.
        See Also:
        restoreState(), isStateSaved()

      • restoreState

        public SimplePDF restoreState()
        Companion method to saveState(); returns font, color and line width settings to the state previously saved by saveState().
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If no call to saveState was made.
        See Also:
        saveState()

      • isStateSaved

        public boolean isStateSaved()
        Indicates whether the SimplePDF instance is currently in "saved state" mode, i.e. saveState() has been invoked without a following call to restoreState().
        See Also:
        saveState()

      • getDocument

        public com.itextpdf.text.Document getDocument()
        Obtains the internal iText Document object.

      • getInternalRenderer

        public com.itextpdf.text.pdf.PdfContentByte getInternalRenderer()
        Obtains the internal iText renderer object. This object contains advanced rendering methods for graphics that are not directly supported by SimplePDF.
        See Also:
        getITextX(), getITextY()

      • setFontInfo

        public SimplePDF setFontInfo(FontInfo fontInfo)
        Sets font information according to values set in fontInfo.

      • getFontInfo

        public FontInfo getFontInfo()
        Obtains the current font information.

      • getWidth

        public float getWidth()
        Gets the useable page width, i.e. between page margins; this is determined by the PageInfo instance passed to SimplePDF's constructor, as well as by SimplePDF.setMargins().

      • getHeight

        public float getHeight()
        Gets the useable page height, i.e. between page margins; this is determined by the PageInfo instance passed to SimplePDF's constructor, as well as by SimplePDF.setMargins().

      • setMargins

        public SimplePDF setMargins(float top,
                            float right,
                            float bottom,
                            float left)
        Sets the margins on the page.

      • setX

        public SimplePDF setX(float x)
        Sets the X coordinate relative to the left margin. setX(0) will set the coordinate position directly over the left margin; setX(mySimplePDF.getWidth()) will set the coordinate position directly over the right margin.

      • setY

        public SimplePDF setY(float y)
        Sets the Y coordinate relative to the top margin. setY(0) will set the coordinate position directly on the top margin; setY(mySimplePDF.getHeight()) will set the coordinate position directly on the bottom margin.

      • setXY

        public SimplePDF setXY(float x,
                       float y)
        A shortcut to setX(x).setY(y).

      • moveX

        public SimplePDF moveX(float distance)
        Moves the internal X coordinate; positive values of distance will move to the right, negatives values to the left.

      • moveY

        public SimplePDF moveY(float distance)
        Moves the internal Y coordinate; positive values of distance will move down, negatives values move up.

      • move

        public SimplePDF move(float xDistance,
                      float yDistance)
        A shortcut to moveX(xDistance).moveY(yDistance).

      • getX

        public float getX()
        Obtains the X coordinate position, relative to the left margin.
        See Also:
        setX(float)

      • getY

        public float getY()
        Obtains the Y coordinate position, relative to the top margin.
        See Also:
        setY(float)

      • willMovePastBottom

        public boolean willMovePastBottom(float distance)
        Determines whether the intended vertical position change will move past the bottom margin; useful when deciding whether to start a new page. Does not change the current position, however.
        Returns:
        True if moveY(distance) will move the Y coordinate below the bottom margin.

      • getITextX

        public float getITextX()
        This obtains the X coordinate as seen by iText. This is only useful when making direct calls to the iText PDFContentByte instance.
        See Also:
        getInternalRenderer()

      • getITextY

        public float getITextY()
        This obtains the Y coordinate as seen by iText. This is only useful when making direct calls to the iText PDFContentByte instance.
        See Also:
        getInternalRenderer()

      • setColor

        public SimplePDF setColor(com.itextpdf.text.BaseColor bc)
        Sets the "fill" and "stroke" colors, i.e. the colors for text and line art. Does not affect the color of Images.

      • setColor

        public SimplePDF setColor(int red,
                          int green,
                          int blue)
        A shortcut to setColor(new BaseColor(red, green, blue));

      • setColor

        public SimplePDF setColor(java.awt.Color color)
        Sets the color using Java's standard Color object. This is passed directly to iText's BaseColor object.

      • setLineWidth

        public SimplePDF setLineWidth(float f)
        Sets the line width used for drawing lines and rectangles. Does not affect lines already drawn.

      • getLineWidth

        public float getLineWidth()

      • drawLine

        public SimplePDF drawLine(float xDistance,
                          float yDistance)
        Draws a straight line from the current X,Y coordinates according to the distance specified by xDistance and yDistance, using the current line width and color. Note that width-wise, half of the line will appear to either side of the actual path drawn.
        Parameters:
        xDistance - Positive values draw to the right, negative to the left.
        yDistance - Positive values draw downwards, negative upwards.
        See Also:
        setLineWidth(float), setColor(BaseColor)

      • drawRect

        public SimplePDF drawRect(float width,
                          float height)

        Draws a rectangle outline from the current X,Y coordinates according to the distance specified by width and height, using the current line width and color.

        Note that the line will drawn be inside the specified coordinates, not half-in/half-out; although this is atypical, it allows easier control of the rectangle's position.

        Parameters:
        width - Positive values draw to the right, negative to the left.
        height - Positive values draw downwards, negative upwards.
        See Also:
        setLineWidth(float), setColor(BaseColor), fillRect(float, float)

      • drawRectRounded

        public SimplePDF drawRectRounded(float width,
                                 float height,
                                 float offsetTL,
                                 float offsetTR,
                                 float offsetBR,
                                 float offsetBL)

        Generally the same as drawRect(), but with rounded corners. The specified offsets should be the perpendicular distance from each corner (i.e. the distance along the x and y axes from the corner) where that corner's curve begins.

        Parameters:
        width - The width of the rectangle.
        height - The height of the rectangle.
        offsetTL - Offset from the top left.
        offsetTR - Offset from the top right.
        offsetBR - Offset from the bottom right.
        offsetBL - Offset from the bottom left.

      • fillRectRounded

        public SimplePDF fillRectRounded(float width,
                                 float height,
                                 float offsetTL,
                                 float offsetTR,
                                 float offsetBR,
                                 float offsetBL)
        The same as drawRectRounded(), but fills the rectangle with the current color.
        See Also:
        drawRectRounded(float, float, float, float, float, float), setColor(BaseColor)

      • fillRect

        public SimplePDF fillRect(float width,
                          float height)
        Fills in a rectangle from the current X,Y coordinates according to the distance specified by width and height, using the current line width.
        Parameters:
        width - Positive values draw to the right, negative to the left.
        height - Positive values draw downwards, negative upwards.
        See Also:
        setLineWidth(float), setColor(BaseColor), drawRect(float, float)

      • draw

        public SimplePDF draw(com.itextpdf.text.Image image)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Draws image at the current X,Y coordinate position, according the size determined by image.getScaledHeight() and image.getScaledWidth()
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        loadImage(InputStream)

      • draw

        public SimplePDF draw(java.lang.String text)
        Draws text to the right of the current X,Y coordinate position.

      • drawAndMoveX

        public SimplePDF drawAndMoveX(java.lang.String text)
        Draws text to the right of the current X,Y coordinate position and moves the X coordinate to the end of the text; equivalent to draw(text).moveX(getWidth(text)).

      • drawToLeft

        public SimplePDF drawToLeft(java.lang.String text)
        Draws text to the left of the current X,Y coordinate position, i.e. right-justifies the text.

      • drawCentered

        public SimplePDF drawCentered(java.lang.String text,
                              float width)
        Draws text centered on the current X,Y coordinate position.

      • lineFeed

        public SimplePDF lineFeed()
        Moves the Y coordinate downwards by the amount of getFontInfo().getTextLineHeight(); does not affect the X coordinate.
        See Also:
        FontInfo.getTextLineHeight()

      • lineFeedWillExceed

        public boolean lineFeedWillExceed()
        Determines whether lineFeed() will push the Y coordinate down below the bottom margin.

      • newPage

        public SimplePDF newPage()
        Starts a new page in the document. Does not change the current X,Y coordinates, so those may need to be set before drawing anything.
        See Also:
        setXY(float, float)

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Closes the internal iText Document object and the OutputStream.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
